# Don't modify this file manually. This file is auto generated from source, and you will lose your changes next time the website is built.
# Head to the `biomejs/biome` repository, and modify the source code in there.

title: noUselessTernary
description: |
  Disallow ternary operators when simpler alternatives exist.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/complexity/noUselessTernary`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `v1.5.0`
:::note
- This rule is recommended by Biome. A diagnostic error will appear when linting your code.
- This rule has an **unsafe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-unneeded-ternary" target="_blank"><code>no-unneeded-ternary</code></a>

## Description
Disallow ternary operators when simpler alternatives exist.

It’s a common mistake in JavaScript to use a conditional expression to select between two
boolean values instead of using the logical NOT (`!`) or double NOT (`!!`) to convert the test to a boolean.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
var a = x ? true : true;
```

```js
var a = foo === 1 ? false : true;
```

```js
var a = foo + 1 ? true : false;
```

### Valid

```js
var a = x === 2 ? 'Yes' : 'No';
```

```js
var a = x === 2 ? 'Yes' : false;
```

## Resources

Logical NOT: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Logical_NOT

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"complexity": {
				"noUselessTernary": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
